Title: 42009 - # Ways to Make Your Business More Attractive to New Customers
Direction: 500 words. Make a list of three to six ways entrepreneurs can make their businesses more attractive to new customers. There are obviously plenty of things you could include in this list, such as handing out alluring coupons and renovating the location so it has an updated aesthetic. Make sure you include a section about using high risk merchant services so the business can accept credit card payments even if it's in a high-risk industry. Your target audience is women who might also be small business owners.

Title: 42010 - # Thriving Business Concepts You Should Research Now
Direction: 500 words. Make a list of three to six business concepts that are popular right now. You can write about businesses in any industry that is doing well, such as app development, online gambling, and ride-sharing. But make sure you include an option that's considered high-risk, like e-cigs, fantasy sports, and debt collection. You can include the client link and keyword in the high-risk business's section. Your audience is interested in business.

Title: 42011 - # Ways High Risk Merchants Benefit from Accepting Credit Cards
Direction: 500 words. Write about three to six ways high risk merchants of all kinds stand to benefit from accepting credit cards. High risk merchants belong to a category of commerce with higher chargeback and fraud rates. Sometimes, a high-risk merchant utilizes third-party payment systems because they can't open their own merchant account. Or they avoid opening for fear of closure. Discuss the reasons why high-risk merchants should open up a merchant account for cards, and the benefits they stand to receive. Consider anchoring the text to a sentence that talks about the fact that high-risk providers are highly competitive with low-risk ones. Your target audience is interested in information about saving money and increasing income.

Title: 42012 - # Reasons Why Bad Credit Doesn't Mean It's Impossible to Open a Merchant Account
Direction: 500 Words. Write 3 to 6 reasons why having bad credit doesn't automatically mean an individual can't open a merchant account for their business. Merchant service providers use personal credit ratings to determine if they're going to open an account with someone even though they're operating a business. Low-risk providers are strict about who they'll work with even the money is used for processing credit cards only. High-risk providers tend to be less concerned with the credit rating of their clients. Consider anchoring the URL to a sentence that discusses why bad credit won't prevent someone from getting a merchant account and include the keywords. Your target audience is interested in personal finance information.

Title: 42013 - # Reasons Why Improving Bad Credit Helps Get a Merchant Service Account
Direction: 500 words. Write about three to six reasons why improving a bad credit score makes it easier to get a merchant service account. Low-risk providers tend to reject applicants with bad credit for various reasons. Improving a credit score increases the likelihood of approval with the low-risk providers, but keeping a low-risk account open is sometimes tricky. Focus on those who are trying to start a business but have issues with their credit score and are looking for options. Consider putting the keywords in a sentence that discusses the fact that having bad credit doesn't always mean an automatic denial of a merchant account.
Anchor Text: credit card processing with bad credit
